Usage.Explanation: Arguments specified with an implicit, comma-separated order

Operands.Explanation: Operand has special meaning, see Remarks

Description: Allows the program to jump to a subroutine and return back after completion. This command is often used to call reusable code.

Description.3: Conditional statement/s thatmust evaluate true for jumpto occur
Description.4: A value, variable, or array topass to the subroutine beingcalled

Notes.0: Must be a valid label in application code
Notes.1: Firmware Rev 1.2a and later. May be a value or avariable, but not an evaluated statement withparenthesis
Notes.2: May be a value or a variable, but not anevaluated statement with parenthesis
Notes.3: If omitted, the jump is taken
Notes.4: referenced from within the subroutine as ^a-^h,respectively. See Remarks for a table of validargs
